description: An introduction to the sociolinguistic situation of the French language in France and throughout the world. The course begins with a consideration of the development of French as a national language and an overview of the contemporary status of regional languages and dialects within France. The focus of the rest of the course will be on the role of the French language throughout the world, including North America, the Caribbean, Africa, as well as in the future of Europe. Emphasis will be put on the role of language in cultural and social identity as well as in political power and conflict. Of interest not only to majors but to students in international relations, Wharton, etc.
name: Tours de France: French History Seen Through the Prism of Tours (in French)
